qas.question: Brass instruments were traditionally played by profession guild members during what era?
Stringed instruments during the Renaissance included the viol, the lyre, the cittern, the lute and what other instrument?
The virginal is what type of instrument?
The tambourine, bells and rumble-pot are all what type of instrument?
The reed pipe and recorder are what type of instrument?

context: Brass instruments in <a0_0>the Renaissance<a0_0/> were traditionally played by professionals who were members of Guilds and they included the slide trumpet, the wooden cornet, the valveless trumpet and the sackbut. Stringed instruments included the viol, the harp-like lyre, <a1_0>the hurdy-gurdy<a1_0/>, the cittern and the lute. <a2_0>Keyboard instruments with strings<a2_0/> included the harpsichord and the virginal. <a3_0>Percussion<a3_0/> instruments include the triangle, the Jew's harp, the tambourine, the bells, the rumble-pot, and various kinds of drums. <a4_0>Woodwind<a4_0/> instruments included the double reed shawm, the reed pipe, the bagpipe, the transverse flute and the recorder.
